edu.harvard.integer.service.distribution

Class DistributionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.harvard.integer.service.distribution.DistributionManager

  • public class DistributionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to lookup managers in the Integer system. The manager may be running on the local server or on a remote server. The lookup of the manager is the same in both cases.

    Ex.

    ServiceElementDiscoveryManager discoveryManager = DitributionManager.getManager (ManagerTypeEnum.ServiceElementDiscoveryManager);

    To lookup a manager on a specific server the serverId will need to be passed into the getManager() call.

      • getService

        public static <T extends BaseServiceInterface> T getService(ServiceTypeEnum type)
                                                 throws edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException
        This method is used to get a reference to a service. The service could be running on this server or a remote service. The returned instance can be used as if it was a local reference.

        Ex:

        DiscoveryService discoveryService = DistributionManager.getService(ServiceTypeEnum.DiscoveryService)

        Parameters:
        type - . ServiceTypeEnum of the service that is requested.
        Returns:
        reference to a Service.
        Throws:
        edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException

                                            ServiceTypeEnum type)
                                                 throws edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException
        This call is used when there are multiple instances of the service running in the integer system.

        public static <T extends BaseManagerInterface> T getManager(ManagerTypeEnum managerType)
                                                 throws edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException

        Ex:

        DiscoveryManager discoveryManager = DistributionManger.getManager(ManagerTypeEnum.DiscoveryManager)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        reference to a manager.
        Throws:
        edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException

      • getManager

        public static <T extends BaseManagerInterface> T getManager(java.lang.Long serverId,
                                            ManagerTypeEnum managerType)
                                                 throws edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException
        Get a reference to a manager. This call is used when the caller knows where the manager is running and there is more than one instance of the manager running in the system.

        Ex:

        Long serverId = CoreServerId;

        DiscoveryManager discoveryManager = DistributionManger.getManager(serverid, ManagerTypeEnum.DiscoveryManager)

        Parameters:
        serverId - . The server id of the server where the manager is running.
        managerType - . Manager type of the manager that is desired.
        Returns:
        A reference to a manager.
        Throws:
        edu.harvard.integer.common.exception.IntegerException

      • getManagers

        public static edu.harvard.integer.common.distribution.DistributedManager[] getManagers()
        Return the list of managers that are known to the system. This is the complete list of managers NOT just what is running on the local server.
        Returns:
        list of the managers in the system.

      • setManagers

        public static void setManagers(edu.harvard.integer.common.distribution.DistributedManager[] distributeManagers)
        Set the list of managers that are valid for the complete system NOT just what is valid on the local server.
        Parameters:
        managers - the managers to set

        public static edu.harvard.integer.common.distribution.DistributedService[] getServices()
